definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
separating medical consultation from dispensing drugs, proposed policy to counteract perceived PRC problem of "drugs serving to nourish doctors" 以藥養醫|以药养医[yi3 yao4 yang3 yi1]

sentences.english: At last, the general equation for separation of high order definite err…
sentences.chinese: 最后给出了分离多阶确定性误差的通式。
但是，执行功能具有可分离性。

sentences.english: Simulations have been made to validate the good separation performance of the algor…
sentences.chinese: 仿真验证对声音等非平稳信号具有良好的分离效果。

sentences.english: The two fish of Pisces show Christianity's split between spirit and matter.
sentences.chinese: 双鱼宫的两条鱼表明基督教的灵性与物质的分离。
提供了分离的多核苷酸。

sentences.english: But the Separatists discovered that the Speedwell leaked and therefore could not make the journey.
sentences.chinese: 可是分离派发现斯碧薇尔号漏水了，所以无法航行。

sentences.english: Separation from his girl-friend made him sad.
sentences.chinese: 与女友的分离使他很伤心。

sentences.english: This is due to the decoupled approach of this pattern.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为该模式采用了完全分离的方式。

sentences.english: A digital-analog PLL is the main part of the data separator.
sentences.chinese: 这个数据分离器的主要部分是一个数模混合的锁相环。

sentences.english: The basic principle of a detached type erasible and rewritable reinforced optic head is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析了加固型可摄重写分离式光学头的基本工作原理。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To study the infectivity of the Vibrio parahaernolyticus isolated from the brine.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究从海水中分离出的副溶血弧菌的致病性。

sentences.english: The positive and negative charges are then separated by updrafts and gravity, producing the electric field.
sentences.chinese: 正负电荷受上升气流与重力的影响而分离，产生电场。

sentences.english: Without confirmed re-union, we may all find it hard to bear and wait.
sentences.chinese: 没有确定的重聚，我们也许都会觉得很难忍受分离。

sentences.english: After centrifugation, the purity of the crude product was 23%.
sentences.chinese: 离心分离后，血红素粗品的纯度为23%。

sentences.english: Finally, delegating logic often leads to a cleaner separation of concerns.
sentences.chinese: 最后，委派逻辑通常会得到更干净的关注点分离。

definition: to peel/to strip/to peel off/to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to disassociate/to drift away/to leave (a collective)/free (component)
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
